messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:19): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: what do the other two browsers do?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:19): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, other browsers make the bullets overlap the floats
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:19): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, the bullet is always displaced from the first line by border+padding
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:19): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, but the line isn't moved to compensate
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:20): so the bullet are on the left of a left float?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:20): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, (see also the three messages I just sent to www-style about float-displace)
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:20): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, no, they overlap a left float
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:21): right but on which side though? left?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:21): they're a fixed distance (border + padding of the list item) from the right edge of the left float
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:22): it's the formula you'd want if you also had float-displace indenting the line
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:22): then i don't understand what you mean by "the line isn't moved to compensate"
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:23): except float-displace isn't indenting the line, so the bullet overlaps the float
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:23): Starting from the beginning, what other browsers do is position the bullet relative to the first line box of the block.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:23): or the place that said line box would start if there were one
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:24): that line box is flush against the float
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:24): looks for a testcase
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:24): i guess i don't understand how that differs from float-displace, given the right values of float-displace
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:25): https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=302070
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:25): it's like everybody's doing the right thing, except without setting float-displace:line on list items
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:25): which means if we become consistent
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:25): we'll never be able to change that default
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:25): whereas now Mozilla is doing something that means float-displace:line would be a compromise between existing browsers
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:26): so people could move to that default
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:27): i have to admit finding it difficult to really care :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:27): i think we should introduce float-displace and the other property
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:27): well, float-displace as specced is rather broken
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:27): but it's easily fixable
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:27): but i've given up trying to make bert and fantasai see reason, so i'm not planning on trying to get any work done in the csswg any time soon
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:28): ok, I guess I'll back out my patch
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:28): what did your patch do?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:28): or most of it, anyway
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:28): it made Mozilla match the behavior of other browsers
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:28): where the bullets overlap the float
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:28): but we don't move blocks
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:30): isn't that one of the values of float-displace and company?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:30): moving blocks is, but it really sucks
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:30): I think we want to get rid of it, except for things that introduce new BFCs
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:30): where it would be the default
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:31): so what's wrong with the behaviour of other browsers?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:31): bullets overlap floats
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:31): pretty much any time they're next to floats
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:38): hm
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:38): that does suck
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:38): So I don't think I have a good excuse for implementing float-displace this far after feature freeze.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:39): But I think I can leave most of what I fixed in.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:39): yeah
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (05:50): but still back out the change removing -moz-float-edge: margin-box from li
